info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 12:50PM EDT until October 12 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Horry.
* WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Near the coast, the high tide will slow runoff and result in minor flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen during the past 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, North Myrtle Beach, Red Hill, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Socastee, Hickory Grove, Hammond, Nixonville, Hand, Adrian, Horry Georgetown Technical College Conway Campus, Allsbrook, Coastal Carolina University, Homewood, Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach, Bayboro, Wampee, Cherry Grove Beach, Briarcliffe Acres and Atlantic Beach. - weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
